input.project_name: UPM-Ph1A AHU DX3 Fan Faults and associated BMS control
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: During the April specialist contractor DX service it was found that the Ph1A AHU DX3 has 2 faulty fans and an issue with the system BMS control
scope_of_work.scope: Replace faulty fans on DX3 unit and alter BMS program and relocate temperature sensors to improve the systems control
scope_of_work.justification: Ph1A AHU DX system provides the cooling circuit within the AHU which controls and maintains temperature and humidity of CSC/CSD/CSE suites within acceptable limits
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Difficulty maintaining temperature and humidity within set limits, particularly in the summer months

input.project_name: UPM-HV Switchgear and Transfomer 5Y MAM 2023 - DRUPS & Ph1
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The 5 year HV Switchgear and transformer maintenance for DRUPS sub-stations and Ph1 substations is due in 2023
scope_of_work.scope:
Service of DRUPS substation HV switchgear (3 x RMUs), 2 x Cast Resin Transformers, Phase 1 Roof Substation HV Switchboard and Package Sub RMU, 1 x Cast Resin, 1 x Oil Cooled, 5 x Formel Insulated Transformers. Hire of loadbanks to provide load greater than 30% for sustained daily generator runs during periods of Mains supply loss. Support install of loadbank cables, connection, testing, disconnection.
Replenish fuel stock level following generator runs
scope_of_work.justification: To ensure maximum reliability of electrical infrastructure and confirm operation of associated circuit protection devices

output.overview: Project 'UPM-HV Switchgear and Transfomer 5Y MAM 2023 - DRUPS & Ph1' is located in United Kingdom at site N/A, managed by Qwerty for client Kyndryl. Prepared by Jayme Feil under internal work order UK-EW-10052023-5542. Current status is 'Work in Progress'.
output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: The 5 year HV Switchgear and transformer maintenance for DRUPS sub-stations and Ph1 substations is due in 2023. The defined scope of work includes: Service of DRUPS substation HV switchgear (3 x RMUs), 2 x Cast Resin Transformers, Phase 1 Roof Substation HV Switchboard and Package Sub RMU, 1 x Cast Resin, 1 x Oil Cooled, 5 x Formel Insulated Transformers. Hire of loadbanks to provide load greater than 30% for sustained daily generator runs during periods of Mains supply loss. Support install of loadbank cables, connection, testing, disconnection.
Replenish fuel stock level following generator runs. The justification provided is: To ensure maximum reliability of electrical infrastructure and confirm operation of associated circuit protection devices. If not approved, the effect would be: Increased business risk of switchgear or transformer failure serving the Warwick Data Centre.
output.status_history: First, work in progress by Jayme Feil.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Marge Hills (4):work in progress by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The access corridor to the data centre is looking dated with paintwork peeling off and generally in a poor condition.  There is also an opportunity to upgrade low level lighting to LED occupancy-controlled fittings to reduce energy consumption, running costs, CO2 emissions and associated maintenance costs.
scope_of_work.scope:
Decoration Works:
•	Provide a temporary screen to segregate the half of the corridor being worked on at the time.
•	Provide temporary flooring protection for the duration of the works in the form of Correx sheeting.
•	Clean all existing aluminium glazing bars supporting glass panels.
•	Prepare and paint all existing white structural steelwork with 3 full coats of Rustoleum Noxyde Pegacrl in white.
•	Paint all shadow baton in black eggshell.
•	Supply all required access equipment to complete the works detailed in this document.
•	Remove all waste created by these works from site.
•	Supply as part of final handover an O&M manual detailing all materials used.
Electrical Works:
•	Upgrade low level light fittings for LED occupancy-controlled equivalents
•	Remove all waste created by these works from site.
•	Supply as part of final handover an O&M manual detailing all materials used.
scope_of_work.justification: This is the main entrance to the data centre and provides the first impression for new and existing clients, this area is not up to the standards expected and required of a data centre entrance. If left indefinitely structural problems will begin to occur with corrosion setting in.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: This area will remain in a poor condition leading to poor first impressions of the data centre. Structural problems could eventually occur.
